# Reference
<!-- DO NOT EDIT: This document was generated by Puppet Strings -->

## Table of Contents

**Classes**

* [`ssh`](#ssh): Configures the Secure Shell service on a Redhat Host
* [`ssh::config`](#sshconfig): manages the configuration files for the SSH service
* [`ssh::install`](#sshinstall): A short summary of the purpose of this class
* [`ssh::service`](#sshservice): A short summary of the purpose of this class

## Classes

### ssh

A description of what this class does

* **See also**
https://www.unix.com/man-page/centos/5/sshd_config/

#### Examples

##### 

```puppet
Basic Usage:

class { 'ssh':
  ssh_service_enable       => true,
  ssh_service_ensure       => 'running',
  ssh_config_x11forwarding => 'no',
  ssh_config_print_motd    => 'yes',
}
```

#### Parameters

The following parameters are available in the `ssh` class.

##### `ssh_service_enable`

Data type: `Boolean`

Ensure the service is enabled in systemd

##### `ssh_service_ensure`

Data type: `Enum['running', 'stopped']`

Ensure the service is running

##### `ssh_config_x11forwarding`

Data type: `Enum['yes', 'no']`

Toggle whether X11 forwarding is allowed or not.

##### `ssh_config_print_motd`

Data type: `Enum['yes', 'no']`

Toggle whether the MOTD gets printed at login

##### `ssh_config_print_banner`

Data type: `String[1]`

Toggle whether banner text should be displayed before a user authenticates

##### `ssh_config_banner_content`

Data type: `String[1]`

The contents of what will be /etc/banner (this is a file or template)

##### `ssh_config_banner_path`

Data type: `String[1]`

Location of the banner message

##### `ssh_config_use_dns`

Data type: `Enum['yes', 'no']`

Should only be set to yes if your doing host bases authentication.

##### `ssh_config_strictmodes`

Data type: `Enum['yes', 'no']`

Toggle whether ssh should check for file modes and ownership before accepting login requests

##### `ssh_config_permitrootlogin`

Data type: `Enum['yes', 'no', 'without-password']`

Determine if direct root login is allowed or not

##### `ssh_package_server`

Data type: `String[1]`

The name of the openssh server package.

##### `ssh_package_client`

Data type: `String[1]`

The name of the openssh client package.
